text: Ronald Senator (17 April 1926 - 30 April 2015) was a British composer. He was best known for Holocaust Requiem, for which he was nominated for a Pulitzer Prize. He had concerts in New York (1990, 1998, 2001), London (1989, 1997), Sydney (1978), Moscow (1993), and St. Petersburg (1991). Senator studied at Oxford University (1944-1947) with Austrian-born British composer Egon Wellesz. He was Jewish and married to Miriam Brickman. He lived in London and New York, United States. Senator and his 81-year-old wife died in a fire on 30 April 2015 at their home in Yonkers, New York.
